    • Constructor Detail

      • MouseReactionConfig

        public MouseReactionConfig(int mouseXMaxVelocity,
                           int mouseYMaxVelocity,
                           Angle armAngle,
                           int armAngleMin,
                           Angle armX,
                           int armXMin,
                           int armXMax,
                           Angle armY,
                           int armYMin,
                           int armYMax)
        This saves a reference to the gesture that this reaction belongs to.
        Parameters:
        mouseXMaxVelocity - The pixels per millisecond at which the travels at its maximum speed on the x-axis.
        mouseYMaxVelocity - The pixels per millisecond at which the travels at its maximum speed on the y-axis.
        armAngle - The angle of the chosen arm. Used to determine if it's straight or now.
        armX - The angle between the chosen arm and the opposite shoulder. The degrees along this x-axis away from "zero" will count towards how fast the mouse moves along the x-axis of the monitor.
        armXMin - The minimum angle for the x-axis angle.
        armXMax - The maximum angle for the x-axis angle.
        armY - The angle between the chosen arm and the same side hip. The degrees along this y-axis away from "zero" will count towards how fast the mouse moves along the y-axis of the monitor.
        armYMin - The minimum angle for the y-axis angle.
        armYMax - The maximum angle for the y-axis angle.
